result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles N Morgan Sr

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on February 6, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Letter to Court dated October 25, 2022 re: requesting adjournment of status, filed by Atty. Wang.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim B or his residence listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant to have no violent contact with Victim A and C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.  Defendant to contact the Clerk's office by 4:00 p.m. on Thursday to provide his new address.

9:14 AM Attorney Angela Wang in court for Charles N Morgan Sr.  Attorney Shawn N Woller in court for State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court addresses motion to modify bail filed today.
Victim A/C is present in court today.
State is prepared to address the motion today.
Arguments by the Defense.
State objects to the motion.
Statement by Victim A/C.
For the reasons stated on the record the Court grants the motion and orders the conditions of bond modified to allow no violent contact with Victim A and C.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
